title: E-commerce Logistics with Returns and Time-Sensitive Deliveries
desc_split: An online retailer must efficiently manage last-mile deliveries and returns. Trucks depart from a central warehouse (<loc_depot>) to serve <num_customer> customers located at <loc_customer>. Each customer has a time window during which they can accept a delivery (<demand_linehaul>) or a return pickup (<demand_backhaul>). The service time at each stop is <service_time> minutes. Trucks have a maximum capacity of <capacity> kg, so they must balance outgoing and incoming shipments without exceeding limits. The route can sequence deliveries and pickups in any order, as long as all customers are serviced within their time windows. The objective is to minimize total route distance while adhering to time constraints and capacity limits.
label: vrpmbtw

title: Meal Kit Delivery and Container Recycling
desc_split: A meal kit delivery service uses trucks (<capacity> kg) from a central hub (<loc_depot>) to serve <num_customer> customers. Each customer at <loc_customer> has a time window during which they can accept a delivery of fresh ingredients (<demand_linehaul>) and/or return an empty container (<demand_backhaul>). The service time at each stop is <service_time> minutes. Trucks can sequence deliveries and pickups in any order along their route, as long as they donâ€™t exceed capacity and all customers are serviced within their time windows. The goal is to minimize route distances while efficiently managing the mix of outbound and inbound loads.
label: vrpmbtw

title: Residential Recycling Pickup and Bin Delivery
desc_split: A municipal recycling service operates from a central depot (<loc_depot>) and must collect recyclables from some households and deliver new bins to others. Each customer location (<loc_customer>) has a specific time window during which they can be serviced. The service involves either a pickup of recyclables (<demand_backhaul>) or a delivery of bins (<demand_linehaul>), each with a <service_time> duration. The service vehicles have a <capacity> kg capacity and can arrange their routes to include both pickups and deliveries in any sequence, provided they stay within capacity and time constraints. The goal is to minimize total route distance while ensuring all households are serviced on time.
label: vrpmbtw

title: Event Venue Equipment Logistics with Synchronized Timelines
desc_split: An event logistics company must deliver equipment to <num_customer> venues and later retrieve it. The goal is to minimize total route distance while ensuring all equipment is delivered and collected on schedule without overloading the trucks.

title: Pharmacy Medication Delivery and Medical Waste Collection

The objective is to minimize total travel distance while ensuring all pharmacies receive supplies and have their waste collected on time.
label: vrpmbtw

title: Agricultural Supply Delivery and Harvest Collection

Routes must ensure timely deliveries to avoid crop damage and efficient pickup coordination with harvest timelines, all while optimizing fuel usage and respecting vehicle weight limits.

title: Solar Panel Installation and Old Panel Removal Logistics
desc_split: A renewable energy company installs new solar panels at residential sites while removing outdated panels for recycling. Delivery trucks carry new panels (linehaul) and collect old ones (backhaul), constrained by vehicle capacity. Customers schedule installations and removals within specific time windows (e.g., around weather or permit deadlines). Routes must sequence deliveries and pickups flexibly, respecting capacity limits and ensuring all tasks are completed on time.
label: vrpmbtw

title: Temporary Office Setup and Dismantling Logistics
desc_split: A company provides temporary office solutions by delivering furniture and IT equipment to event venues and later retrieving them for reuse. Vehicles have capacity limits for both deliveries and pickups. Venues require setup and teardown within strict time windows tied to event schedules. The challenge is to design routes that allow technicians to sequence deliveries and pickups as needed, minimizing travel costs while adhering to time constraints and capacity limits.
label: vrpmbtw

title: Offshore Oil Rig Equipment Supply and Tool Retrieval with Time Windows
desc_split: A maritime logistics company must deliver maintenance equipment and spare parts to offshore oil rigs while retrieving used tools, waste, and recyclable materials. Each rig has a time window for access due to tidal restrictions and operational schedules. The vehicles must balance mixed deliveries and pickups without exceeding their capacity, ensuring all cargo is handled within strict environmental and safety regulations.
label: vrpmbtw
